intro: Curcuma australasica, commonly known as the New Zealand turmeric, is a rhizomatous herb native to New Zealand. It belongs to the ginger family, Zingiberaceae, and is characterized by its aromatic, yellowish rhizomes. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, while its flowers are pale yellow to greenish-white. The rhizomes are used in traditional Māori medicine and have potential culinary and medicinal applications.
